provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7.-( 1) When an application for registration is made, the Registration.
Registrar shall satisfy himself that the society has complied
with the provisions of this Act and any regulations made
thereunder and that the society is a bona fide co-operative
society and that its proposed rules are in conformity with
the requirements of this Act and any regulations made
thereunder, and for these purposes may make such enquiries
and obtain such information as he thinks fit.
       (2) The Registrar upon being satisfied of the fore-
going matters may register the society and its rules and
shall publish notice thereof in the Gazette.
8                                  CO-OPERATIVE SOCIETIES

                appeal shall lie to the tribunal appointed by regulations
                under this Act within one month from the date of such
                refusal. The decision of the tribunal shall be final and shall
                not be called in question in any civil court.

provisions.title: Section 41
provisions.content:
41.-( 1) If the Registrar, after holding an inquiry or Diaolution.

application made by three-fourths of the members of a
registered society is of opinion that the society ought to
be dissolved, he may by order cancel the registration of

two months from the date of an order under subsection (1)
appeal from such order to the tribunal appointed by regu-

be final, and shall not be called in question in any civil
court.

tribunal appointed by regulations under this Act.

ments and the protection of the assets of the society until
the order cancelling registration takes effect.
